intro: Sarcogonum adpressum, commonly known as the flatworts, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, creeping habit and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces tiny, greenish-yellow flowers that are arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Sarcogonum adpressum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a fibrous root system and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
